sentences.en: 'You have had your bottle , I perceive, Sydney.'
sentences.cn: “ 我看,你已经喝过了, 西德尼. ”

sentences.en: "Precisely what other problems do you perceive?" she asked.
sentences.cn: “你究竟还发现了什么问题？”她问道。

sentences.en: Ah! You can make that lute discourse, I perceive.
sentences.cn: 啊! 我发现,你是能够让那只弦琴发出声音的.

sentences.en: Cats are not able to perceive colour.
Did you perceive anyone entering the laboratory?
sentences.cn: 你看见有人进入实验室 吗 ?

sentences.en: I can't perceive any difference between these coins.
sentences.cn: 我看不出这些硬币的区别.

sentences.en: I perceive a coaxing sound in that soft strain of yours.
sentences.cn: 我从你轻柔的弹奏里听出了恳求的声音.

sentences.en: I plainly perceive some objections remain.
sentences.cn: 我清楚地察觉到还有一些反对意见.

sentences.en: Stress is widely perceived as contributing to coronary heart disease.
sentences.cn: 压力普遍被认为能造成冠心病。

sentences.en: That morning, he perceived a change in Franca’s mood.
sentences.cn: 那天早上，他注意到弗兰卡情绪的变化。

sentences.en: The Confederate States perceive that they cannot carry all before them with a rush.
sentences.cn: 南部邦联可以看出,他们不可能突然一下子大获全胜.

sentences.en: The handicap of age she did not, in her enthusiasm, perceive.
sentences.cn: 她在兴奋的时候, 觉察不到年龄的障碍.成功的人总会这样说的.

sentences.en: The illustrious Cuvier did not perceive that a barnacle was a crustacean.
sentences.cn: 大名鼎鼎的居维叶也未看出藤壶是一种甲壳动物.

sentences.en: They only recognise badness when they perceive it in others.
sentences.cn: 他们只看到别人身上的恶行。

sentences.en: This discovery was perceived as a major breakthrough.
sentences.cn: 这一发现被视为一项重大突破。

sentences.en: This lad Hawkins is a trump, I perceive.
sentences.cn: 我看霍金斯这孩子也是好样的.

sentences.en: Voters perceive him as a decisive and resolute international leader.
sentences.cn: 投票者认为他是一位坚定果断的国际领导人。

sentences.en: We perceive him wish to make progress.
sentences.cn: 我们看得出他是要求进步的.

sentences.en: You can easily perceive what he wants.
sentences.cn: 你可轻而易举地看出他要什么.

words.tran_cn: 可察觉的；可感知的；看得见的
感知的，知觉的；有知觉力的
显然地；可感觉得出地；看得出地
感觉力；理解力；可察觉性
知觉；[生理] 感觉；看法；洞察力；获取
感知；认为（perceive的过去分词）；领会

trans.tran_en: to understand or think of something or someone in a particular way

trans.tran_cn: 感知， 感觉， 察觉； 认识到， 意识到； 理解
trans.tran_en: to understand or think of something or someone in a particular way
